div.strong: New Jersey Department of Children and Families Resources

a.title: Go to comments for New Jersey Department of Children and Families Resources

p.span: Pre-K and Kindergarten registration for the 2020-2021 school year will be held during the summer. Information will be updated when regular school hours resume. For more information please contact Mrs. Hagel - School Registrar: (609) 965-1034 x 136 or dhagel@eggharborcityschools.com

The Egg Harbor City Public School District will be conducting their annual Project Child Find, which supports children in need of a preschool disabilities program designed for ages 3 to 5 years old. If you are concerned your child may not be typically developing and are a resident of Egg Harbor City please contact the districts Special Projects Department at (609) 965-1034 x 136 for more information.

a.title: Go to comments for Pre-K and Kindergarten Registration / Project Child Find

ul.li: Will be emailed to CLS parents/guardians on 4/20/2020.
Will be available in the Genesis Parent Portal for EHCCS parents/guardians on 4/20/2020.
As we move into this next marking period all students will be graded on Pass/Fail criteria.
If this should change atany point upon returning to a regular school setting you will be informed.
Students will be graded on their completion, submission,participation,and understanding oftheir work related to assignments, projects, tests, quizzes, etc.
Information regarding report card grades and disseminationat the end of the marking period will be shared at a later date.
Se enviarn por correo electrnico a los padres/tutores de CLS el 4/20/2020.
Estarn disponibles en el Portal para Padres de Gnesis de EHCCSel 4/20/2020.
A medida que avanzamos en este prximo perodo de calificaciones, todos los estudiantes sern calificados con el criterio de Pasar / Reprobar.
Si esto cambiara en algn momento al regresar a la escuela, se les informar.
Los estudiantes sern calificados al completar, presentar, participar y comprender su trabajo relacionado con las tareas, proyectos, pruebas, exmenes, etc.
La informacin relacionada a la tarjeta de calificaciones y la difusin al final del perodo de calificacin ser compartida en una fecha posterior.

p.span: Please use the link below for more information about theSPRING BREAK MEALS TO EHC SCHOOL FAMILIES

span.a: SPRING BREAK MEALS TO EHC SCHOOL FAMILIES

a.title: Go to comments for SPRING BREAK MEALS TO EHC SCHOOL FAMILIES

p.span: Good Afternoon EHC families. In an effort to meet the needs of more families we have a change in our food distribution schedule. Starting tomorrow, Thursday we will be distributing multiple meals to families. On Mondays we will be distributing 3 days worth of meals to families and on Thursdays we will be distributing 2 days worth of meals to families. Additionally, we have added distribution sites to our schedules. From 8-10 am we will still be distributing food at the Community School. Then from 10:15-11:15 we will be distributing meals at the Village Apts. You can pick up your meals from our food service company and our friendly School Resource Officers near the mailboxes. Just look for Officer Ed or Officer Keith. From 11:30-12:30 we will move over to the Washington Avenue apartments and distribute food at the mailboxes there as well. This program is available to all students in our schools so please take advantage of it. Thank you and have a nice night.

a.title: Go to comments for Food Distribution Schedule

p.span: Please use the link below to visit our school districts family resource page on Facebook. The page was created to help Egg Harbor City families with informative resources provided within the district and community. We encourage members to share any information that helps keep our community, families, and schools connected.

p.span: Parents and guardians in need of child care can contact the Child Care Resource and Referral Agency in their county. CCR&Rs will have the most up to date information on available care options and subsidies. Go towww.nj.gov/dcf/coronavirus

p.span: Internet Essentials from Comcast brings you affordable, high-speed Internet. We want to make it easier for low-income households to get connected so they can more easily work from home, access educational resources, and stay in contact with friends and family. You may be eligible for 2 months of free Internet Essentials service. Available for new Internet Essentials customers only. Apply by April 30, 2020. Please use the link below to view the Comcast flyer in English and Spanish to get more information.

a.title: Go to comments for Staying Connected During the Coronavirus Situation

p.span: Dear Parents, Guardians and Members of the School Community,

Since the 2011-12 school year, New Jerseys School Performance Reports have provided families, educators and the public a picture of overall school performance. As part of New Jerseys accountability system, the performance reports provide valuable information across many elements, including schoolwide academic achievement and progress, demographics, school climate, chronic absenteeism, and college and career readiness.
We invite you to check New JerseysSchool Performance Reportsonline to view the latest reports.

div.span: You can view Egg Harbor City Public School District, Spragg School, andCommunity Schoolreports directly.

a.title: Go to comments for New Jersey School Performance Reports

p.span: Register Ready New Jerseys Special Needs Registry for Disasters allows New Jersey residents with disabilities or access and functional needs and their families, friends, caregivers and associates an opportunity to provide information to emergency response agencies so emergency responders can better plan to serve them in a disaster or other emergency.
